The use of a photoshopped image: The expert's verdict mentions that during the program, Abhisar Sharma flashed a photoshopped image of an Aaj Tak promo on Chandrayaan-2. This aspect of using a manipulated image was employed to verify the authenticity of the claim.
Confirmation from Aaj Tak anchor: Chitra Tripathi, an anchor from Aaj Tak, tweeted about the misinformation and clarified that the image used in the HW News broadcast was photoshopped. This confirmation from an authoritative source adds to the verification process.
Comparison with original image: The expert's verdict highlights that the original Aaj Tak promo had different text compared to the photoshopped version. The original image had the words "अब चांद हमारी मुट्ठी में (The moon is now in our clutches)," while the manipulated image included Prime Minister Modi's name in the sentence. This comparison between the original and manipulated images helps establish the inauthenticity of the claim.
Correction and removal of misinformation: After the error was brought to the notice of HW News and Abhisar Sharma, the channel took down its broadcast and uploaded it again after deleting the misinformation. This aspect of acknowledging and rectifying the mistake indicates a commitment to accuracy and authenticity.
